comments.content:
According to this [post](http://web.archive.org/web/20140724104521/http:/www.myfonts.com/WhatTheFont/forum/case/32999) on WTF Forum should be **Letraset English Tudor** , an open face blackletter with open areas filled in.

> This sample is actually a typeface called English Tudor which was dewigned by Letraset in 1981 as dry-transfer lettering.  
> English Tudor was an open face black letter, the sample shown is someone filled in the open areas to make a solid version for the logo shown.  
> English Tudor has not been digitized as of yet, it could happen by having an open and a solid version.  
> You can find English Tudor in Letraset Graphics Manual (1981-1997).

May be having a look to [Dieter Steffmann blackletter collection](http://web.archive.org/web/20140724104521/http:/moorstation.org/typoasis/designers/steffmann) might worth a shot.

For people who don't have a Letraset book here is a character set of English Tudor, a Letraset design from 1981.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140724104521im_/http:/typophile.com/files/EnglishTudorSM_5205.jpg)
  
Don

Don, thanks a lot for your help. This is really what i was looking for! The only thing i'd like to informe me is, if the particular font is available in digital form.  
Thank's a lot, anyway!

> The only thing i'd like to informe me is, if the particular font is available in digital form.

See the answer on my previous post

> English Tudor has not been digitized as of yet...
